jcr:content.jcr:description: Frankfurt am Main, 12 April 2016 - Worldline [Euronext: WLN], European market leader in payments and transactional services, is expanding its existing cooperation with epay. Following an initial successful project in 2014, the leading full service provider and distributor of prepaid products is installing a further 600 Worldline e-payment YOMANI terminals. Worldline’s modern card readers convinced through their speed and customizable software providing epay specific customer features such as fast processing of gift cards, while the project will also boost Worldline's payment terminals market share.
jcr:content.jcr:title: Worldline and epay build on their alliance

richtext.text:
Attractive e-payment POS platform created by YOMANI terminals

Frankfurt am Main, 12 April 2016 - Worldline [Euronext: WLN], European market leader in payments and transactional services, is expanding its existing cooperation with epay. Following an initial successful project in 2014, the leading full service provider and distributor of prepaid products is installing a further 600 Worldline e-payment YOMANI terminals. Worldline’s modern card readers convinced through their speed and customizable software providing epay specific customer features such as fast processing of gift cards, while the project will also boost Worldline's payment terminals market share.

The installation of 600 modern YOMANI terminals bolsters epay's and Worldline's presence in e-payment processing. The project follows an initial successful rollout in 2014, when both companies installed 800 terminals in Deutsche Telekom stores within 3 months. epay trusts the reliable and rapid YOMANI terminals primarily given their customizable software and reliable provision of specific customer features such as fast processing of gift cards directly on the terminal. Backed by the functionally customizable terminals, epay can offer an attractive and stable POS platform.

Worldline's YOMANI terminals are ideal for retailers who have to serve customers quickly at several checkouts. A colour display and optimized haptics ensure smooth service for the customers. In addition to other communication interfaces, standard terminals come with USB, Ethernet and serial networking. They also provide an integrated PIN system with privacy shield, a special security processor and international certification.

 

Christophe Duquenne, Worldline managing director Merchant Services & Terminals, said: "epay is ideally equipped with its attractive service offering for retailers. Together we provide consumers a fast and user-friendly payment process. Based on the many YOMANI rollouts we can build on our presence in a strategically vital business and boost our share of the terminal market“.

 

Dr. Markus Landrock, epay managing director Germany, explained: "We decided to ramp up our cooperation with Worldline given that in 2014 we installed 800 terminals very successfully. We were won over by Worldline's expertise as a global business, together with the state-of-the-art and reliable YOMANI terminals with their customizable software”.

 


Social Media Messages

(If you would like to talk about this PR on Social Media, please feel free to use the messages below)


Twitter: #Worldline and epay build on their alliance with the installation of 600 additional #epayment YOMANI terminals.

Facebook: #Worldline and epay build on their alliance with the installation of 600 additional #epayment YOMANI terminals, giving epay an attractive and stable e-payment POS platform. Read the PR.

LinkedIn: Worldline and epay build on their alliance with the installation of 600 additional e-payment YOMANI terminals, giving epay an attractive and stable e-payment POS platform. Read the PR.

Worldline [Euronext: WLN] is the European leader in the payments and transactional services industry. Worldline delivers new-generation services, enabling its customers to offer smooth and innovative solutions to the end consumer. Key actor for B2B2C industries, with over 40 years of experience, Worldline supports and contributes to the success of all businesses and administrative services in a perpetually evolving market. Worldline offers a unique and flexible business model built around a global and growing portfolio, thus enabling end-to-end support. Worldline activities are organized around three axes: Merchant Services & Terminals, Mobility & e-Transactional Services, Financial Processing & Software Licensing. Worldline employs more than 7,300 people worldwide and generated 1.22 billion euros revenues in 2015. Worldline is an Atos company. worldline.com

epay is Europe's leading full service provider and distributor of prepaid products. The firm is expert in retaining customer loyalty and is an independent supplier of cashless payments of all types.

epay provides various products and services on electronic payments. As leading provider of prepaid mobile top-up, gift card, bank card, credit and customer card payment services, epay delivers equipment for over 260,000 Touchpoints in German-speaking countries.

epay also offers digital products including music, video games, lifestyle products, software and entertainment.

epay provides user-friendly payment and prepaid solutions for the most reputable digital and physical goods brands backed by the largest global distributors including retail chains, electronic dealers, drugs stores, telecoms operators and banks. In so doing, epay creates the technical and financial means to ensure revenue growth and customer loyalty under the highest security standards throughout its services.

Internationally epay is a division of Euronet Worldwide Inc. (NASDAQ: EEFT) supplying over 674,000 points of sale in 34 countries with epayment solutions.
